org.jpac.plc

Class BitRxTx

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpac.plc.RxTx
      • org.jpac.plc.BitRxTx

  • public class BitRxTx
extends RxTx
    Used to transfer a bit value (boolean) between the java application and the plc. Can be used standalone or in the context of a complex data structure (STRUCT)

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.jpac.plc.RxTx

        address, conn, data, dataOffset, rxReq, rxTrans, txReq, txTrans

      returns the WriteRequest, used to write the data item to the plc

      used to retrieve the current state of the bit.

      used to read the data item from plc and store it inside RxTx.data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BitRxTx

        public BitRxTx(Connection conn,
       Address address,
       int dataOffset,
       Data data)
        throws IndexOutOfRangeException
        Parameters:
        conn - an open TCP/IP connection to the plc
        address - address of the data item exchanged with the plc
        dataOffset - the byte offset inside RxTx.data, holding the data item to be exchanged with the plc
        data - instance of Data used to hold the data item exchanged with the plc.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfRangeException

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public BitRxTx set(boolean state)
            throws AddressException
        used to set the bit to a given boolean value.
        The data item is written to RxTx.data first (true == 1, false == 0).
        The actual transfer to the plc is done by invocation of #writeInt(): aBitRxTx.set(true).writeInt();
        Parameters:
        state - boolean value
        Returns:
        this. Useful in cases where the bit should be written to the plc immediately (see above).
        Throws:
        AddressException

      • is

        public boolean is(boolean state)
           throws AddressException
        used to retrieve the current state of the bit.
        The data item is locally retrieved from RxTx.data (true == 1, false == 0).
        to get the actual value from the plc use read() first: boolean bitState = aBitRxTx.read().is(true);
        Parameters:
        state - expected state of the bit as a boolean value
        Returns:
        true, if the state of the bit equals the expected state
        Throws:
        AddressException

      • read

        public BitRxTx read()
             throws java.io.IOException
        used to read the data item from plc and store it inside RxTx.data.
        Overrides:
        read in class RxTx
        Returns:
        this. Useful in cases, where a data item retrieved from the plc should immediately be processed: boolean bitState = aBitRxTx.read().is(true);
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
